revised_title: High-Pressure Fluid Shear Stress: A Modified Impact Microviscometer Study
tldr: The authors modified an impact microviscometer to measure the ultimate shear stress of fluids at high pressures. They found that three tested fluids displayed non-Newtonian behavior and appeared to approach a limiting shear stress with increasing shear rate. The results suggest that fluids reach a point where they cannot sustain an equivalent increase in shear stress, indicating a potential limiting value of 0.1 Pa for shear stress.
